intro: Ourisia pinnata, commonly known as the fringed broomrape, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant lacks true leaves and chlorophyll, relying on its host for nutrients. Its flowers are small, tubular, and typically pale green or yellowish in color. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as meadows and grasslands.
